</div>

<div class="col-sm-6">

<div>

####`r fa("save", fill="grey")` Install fest (`r fa("stopwatch", fill="grey")`: 1 hr)

1. Create an account at [Github](https://github.com/); [Zoom](https://zoom.us/signup) is optional.
2. Install [R](https://cran.r-project.org/), [Rstudio](https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/), [Slack](https://slack.com/downloads), [Zoom](https://zoom.us/download#client_4meeting) and [Github desktop](https://desktop.github.com/)
3. Join the [Slack workspace](https://get.slack.help/hc/en-us/articles/212675257-Join-a-Slack-workspace). An email will be sent to you requesting you to join after you sign-up.

</div>

</div>
<div class="col-sm-4">

<div>

####`r fa("book-open", fill="grey")` Reading list

1. [R for cats](https://rforcats.net/) (`r fa("stopwatch", fill="grey")`: 2 hrs)
2. [Benefits of versions control](https://www.atlassian.com/git/tutorials/what-is-version-control) (`r fa("stopwatch", fill="grey")`: 1 hr)

####`r fa("chalkboard-teacher", fill="grey")` Class 1

1. What is programming?

    + The many ways to write R code
    + Differences with R
3. Storing variables in R

5. Data structures
6. Deep dive into tabular data structures
7. Subsetting
